text: Shadi Kaur Dam (also "Shadikor") was a dam located on the Shadi Kaur river about north of Pasni in Balochistan province of Pakistan. The dam was long.http://unosat-maps.web.cern.ch/unosat- maps/PK/charter_id084_pakistan_dam_burst_shakidor_dam_before- after_100dpi_A4.jpg It was constructed in 2003 at a cost of 45 million Pakistani Rupees ($758,853) to provide irrigation for nearby farms. On February 10, 2005, the dam burst due to heavy flooding caused by heavy rainfall, resulting in the deaths of about 70 villagers due to drowning and dragging their bodies into the Arabian Sea. Emergency search and rescue operations by the Pakistani military saved the lives of approximately 1,200 people.https://www.usatoday.com/news/world/2005-02-11-pakistan-flood_x.htm ==See also== * List of dams and reservoirs in Pakistan == References == == Notes == ==External links== *PAKISTAN: Evacuations in Balochistan following dam breach * Disease looms after Pakistan floods kill 350 (ChinaDaily, 14 February 2005) * 50 dead, 700 missing in flash flood in Pak (REDiff India Abroad, 11 February 2005) * http://www.unitar.org/unosat/node/44/393 Category:Dams in Balochistan, Pakistan Category:Dam failures Category:Dams completed in 2003
title: Shadi Kaur Dam
